result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Malik Isiah Jones

records.addlTxt:
11:20 AM Defendant Malik Isiah Jones appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Paul J Augustyn in court for Malik Isiah Jones. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF55, 22CF112 & 22CF204. Schiek states there is not an agreement at this time - would like 22CF204 set for a 3 day jury trial - has complied with victim rights. Augustyn in agreement. Bond continued. adj. 11:25 PM
Status conference scheduled for February 1, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 10:00 am.

10:59 AM Defendant Malik Isiah Jones appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Paul J Augustyn in court for Malik Isiah Jones. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF204, 22CF112 & 22CF55. 22CF204 set for a preliminary hearing. State calls Oneida County Sheriff's Detective Sergeant Chad Wanta/sworn/direct by Schiek/Witness identifies Defendant/continued direct by Schiek/cross by Augustyn/witness is excused. Court finds probable cause exists and binds Defendant over. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Augustyn willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bond continued. adj. 11:27 AM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:52 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Malik Isiah Jones appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Paul J Augustyn in court for Malik Isiah Jones. Calling 22CF112 & 22CF55. Sowinski statement to bond - waiting on lab results - states Brown County issued warrant - would like to rescind bond  modification. Augustyn statement to bond. Sowinski states counsel was not involved in bond request. Court states Sheriff called and was against modification. Court will go back to original bond. adj. 02:00 PM
Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Allow release for treatment at Koinonia. The defendant must sign any/all releases to allow the Oneida County Jail or District Attorney's Office to receive information regarding defendant's treatment. 2:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Malik Isiah Jones appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Paul J Augustyn appeared by video for Malik Isiah Jones. Court Reporter appearing by video. Calling 22CF55 & 22CF112. Both cases set for preliminary hearing. Pfeifer will take up 22CF55 first. State calls Oneida County Sheriff's Deputy Will Taege/sworn/direct by Pfeifer/witness identifies Defendant/continued direct by Defendant/cross by Augustyn/witness is excused. Augustyn statement to probable cause. Court finds probable cause exists and binds Defendant over. 22CF112 next case. State calls Oneida County Detective Sergeant Timothy Gensler/sworn/direct by Pfeifer/witness identifies Defendant/continued direct by Pfeifer/cross by Augustyn/witness is excused. Court finds probable cause exists and binds Defendant over. Pfeifer requests a separate arraignment date. Court continues bond. adj. 02:45 PM
Arraignment scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
